result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan B Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by close of business on Wednesday, June 3, 2015.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan B Hanson

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan B Hanson in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney O'Hara recites agreement. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Guilty plea entered to Count 1. The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty. Stipulation to waive PSI - Discussion held - Court waives PSI. State relates. Attorney O'Hara relates. Defendant relates. Court relates and orders:

SW - 3 years Probation - Report to Probation by close of business on Wednesday
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
120 hours of Community Service
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Court costs, assessments and surcharges

Defendant Jonathan B Hanson in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney O'Hara requests reset.
Reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Jonathan B Hanson in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset.  Bond continues.
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jonathan B Hanson in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jonathan B Hanson in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Jonathan B Hanson in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:53  Court relates and gives appearances.
8:54  Detective Jeff Nelson called, sworn, direct by State.  Witness identifies defendant.
8:55  Cross by Atty. O'Hara.
9:02  State moves for bindover.
9:03  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over.
Information filed.
Defense waives formal reading of information.  Defendant pleads not guilty.
Bond to continue in its present form.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant Jonathan B Hanson in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Jonathan B Hanson in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Qualifies for PD. Waives formal reading.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:45 am.
